titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Heinrich Himmler papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-08-02T16:33-0700

change.item: Revised to add links to digital collections site by Sarah Patton.
Information about digitized photo albums and sound recordings added.
Corrected names in container list; updated to add unitid.
Added note that photo albums closed; digital use copies available.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Heinrich Himmler Papers)//EN" "reg_103.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.unittitle: Heinrich Himmler papers

physdesc.extent: 15 manuscript boxes, 5 microfilm reels, 2 photo albums, 6 diaries, 27 sound tape reels

did.abstract: Diaries (1914-1924); photographs; photocopies and microfilm of correspondence, reports, and memoranda from the office files of the personal staff of Heinrich Himmler (1942-1944); and recordings of speeches by Himmler (1940-1944) relating to national socialism in Germany, and activities of the German police and Schutzstaffel during World War II. In part, photocopy and microfilm. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

origination.label: Contributor
origination.corpname: Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiter-Partei. Reichsführer-SS. Persönlicher Stab. Schriftgutverwaltung.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. The two photo albums are closed, but digital use copies of them are available in the reading room and online at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.
Use copies of all sound recordings in this collection are available for immediate access.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: One folder in Box 15 may not be quoted.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Heinrich Himmler papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Reichsführer SS und Chef der deutschen Polizei, 1934-1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Heinrich Himmler papers are largely comprised of a set of photostat documents of the Persönlicher Stab der Reichsführer-SS. The originals of these papers were located in a salt mine in the Salzburg region and seized in 1945 by American forces. In 1946 they were filmed at the Berlin Document Center. These office files include internal office memoranda, correspondence, case files, reports, telegrams, cables, copies of periodicals, remarks, statements, decrees, clippings, drawings, and press releases relating to a variety of topics. The collection also includes speeches and writings, correspondence, diaries, photo albums, and sound recordings.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Original photo albums closed; digital use copies available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two photograph albums containing 237 prints depicting the career of Heinrich Himmler as Reichsführer SS und Chef der deutschen Polizei.

did.unittitle: Album (A),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains photographs of Himmler, including both portraits and outings with troops. Includes one photograph of Adolf Hitler.

did.unittitle: Album (B),
Microfilm Reels,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Microfilm copies of select Persönlicher Stab der Reichsführer-SS office files and diaries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
